content: doggo hood formula while this pattern was first made for two pit bull mixes whose poor ears were freezing in the cold weather it has been adapted as a formula to fit any size of dog with any weight of yarn fill in the dog s measurements and your yarn gauge and it should in theory fit no matter your dog s breed can easily be dressed up with stripes cables colourwork or other stitch patterns materials this pattern is designed to work with any weight of yarn yarn amounts will vary significantly depending on the weight as well as the size of the dog but as a guideline the pit bull hoods were made with about 100 grams of aran weight yarn at a gauge of 14-16 sts/4 on 5 5mm or 6mm needles a chihuahua hood may only take the leftovers from a pair of socks 30 sts/4 3mm needles cable needles are best in a size appropriate for your yarn and a length slightly shorter than your dog s neck measurement for a very small hood try double-pointed needles or the magic loop method pattern notes the neck of the hood is worked in the round from the bottom up then switched to working flat to create the opening for the face before being grafted at the top of the head afterwards stitches are picked up around the face opening to add ribbing step 1 fill in your yarn gauge and measurements a gauge in stockinette - sts/4 row don t need to be counted b a / 4 gauge in stockinette sts/1 dog s measurements c neck not the same as for a collar take this measurement mid-neck or just below the head d head around the top of the head and under the chin e neck length make this as long or as short as you like but will likely be longer for a greyhound than for a pug for example using the above values calculate the following and slot them into the pattern below f b x c rounded to the nearest multiple of 4 g f x 0 85 rounded down to the nearest even number h d / 2 instructions neck cast on f sts join for working in round being careful not to twist sts work in 2x2 rib for e inches knit 3 rnds face opening switch to working flat turn work row 1 ws sl1 p to end row 2 rs sl1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 2 sts decreased repeat these two row until g sts remain row 1 ws sl1 p to end row 2 rs sl1 k to end repeat these two row until work measures h inches from ribbing fold piece in half and using kitchener stitch graft top together ribbing starting with rs facing you at the bottom of the face opening pick up and knit one st in each slip_stitch at the edge around the face opening you ll need
